Chile: HMS Wager is wrecked off the coast of Western Patagonia.
Cuba: British Admiral Edward Vernon captures Guantánamo Bay, renaming it Cumberland Bay, during the War of Jenkins' Ear. His troops withdraw after being decimated by fevers and attacked by local guerrillas.
Italy: Without a sustainable source of income or royal protection, the impoverished Antonio Vivaldi dies of infection during the night.
Russia: Russo-Swedish War (1741–1743): Sweden declared war on Russia.
Elizabeth, the youngest daughter of Peter the Great, led the Preobrazhensky to the Winter Palace to overthrow the regency of Anna Leopoldovna and install herself as empress.
Ivan was imprisoned in the Daugavgriva fortress.
Sweden: The Battle of Villmanstrand takes place.
